text:
I'm wanting to have a form submission that creates a ticket to associate to a record in a custom object based on a text match, a fuzzy match ideally.  I know the fuzzy match will likely require a 3rd party tool, but I can't find a way to associate two records in HubSpot with a basic automation.  Am I missing something?  What's the easiest way to solve this?

It's worth mentioning that the end goal is to assign the ticket to the owner of the custom object.  Basically the custom object is a lookup tool for who should be assigned the ticket based on field data in the service request.
Stumbled on Associ8.  Looks like it might be able to solve this.

I am working on responding to a Workflow Action using the callback `/callbacks/{appId}/{callbackId}/complete`  endpoint. I keep getting 404 errors. I want to make sure that the front of that endpoint is just `<https://api.HubSpot.com/>` . or is it  `<https://api.HubSpot.com/automation/v4/actions/>` ? or something else?

It should be `<https://api.hubapi.com/automation/v4/actions/callbacks/{callbackId}/complete>`

I can't deep link to it, but if you look at the "endpoints" tab on the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions|custom actions API docs>, it's the "complete a callback" one
Doesnâ€™t appId get thrown in there too?
Got it. Thanks <@U0157R7AQ84>   FYI. The Overview tab has a different endpoint documented. It adds /appId into it
Sorry about that! Thanks for flagging this, I've submitted a ticket with our dev docs team to correct the docs
<@U0157R7AQ84> is there someone we can cc when we see or notice things like that?

Have either of you successfully called a Callback Complete? I am doing it and it is giving me the expected 204 HTTP response, but the workflow action is not concluding. Ideas? I am using `/automation/v4/actions/callbacks/{callbackId}/complete`
